story.title: Jealous of a Girl Named Pearl - Episode 1
story.seriesTitle: Jealous of a Girl Named Pearl
story.canonicalTitle: jealous of a girl named pearl
story.storyDescription: Sophia: Hi Jenny. I heard you’re a detective who specializes in cheating cases.
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: Hi Jenny. I heard you’re a detective who specializes in cheating cases.
Yes, this is Are They Cheating? Investigations. Can I help you?
My name is Sophia, and I think my boyfriend William is cheating on me.
With some girl named Pearl.
I’m sorry to hear that, Sophia.
But I know from experience that it’s better to find out sooner than later if someone is cheating.
What’s making you suspicious of William?
Well for one thing, he never lets me see his phone.
It’s like he’s hiding it from me.
Oh, I can look into that.
But it doesn’t necessarily mean he’s cheating.
Do you have any other evidence?
Yeah. He’s been going into the bathroom and locking the door.
And then he talks on the phone with someone in a low voice.
Once, I put my ear up against the door.
And I heard him say Pearl.
Hmmmm.
He said it several times.
Like he just loved saying her name.
It made me heartsick!
Do you know of anyone in his life named Pearl?
No, I don’t.
And I’m so jealous I can’t bear it.
I can understand that.
How long have you been together?
Three years. And we’ve been living together for six months.
Has he ever cheated on you before that you know of?
Never.
But he works in the evenings, and I work during the day.
So he would have plenty of opportunity.
And women are always after him.
Because he’s drop dead handsome. And jacked.
He can bench press 300 pounds.
Wow.
He’s the manliest man I’ve ever met.
And the sexiest.
It must be hard to see all those women chasing after him.
It is! Although it also makes me kind of proud.
Plus he’s always said he only has eyes for me.
And I always believed him until this Pearl came along.
Can you help me, Jenny? Can you get started right away?
If you send me a $500 down payment via PayPal, I can start tomorrow.
Then text me his full name, photo, work address, home number and home address.
And I’ll start tailing him.
Okay, thanks. I really hope he isn’t cheating.
But I honestly don’t know what else it could be.
The next morning, Jenny parks her car outside the house that William shares with Sophia.
She sees Sophia leave for work.
Then she waits.
Two hours later, the front door opens and William emerges, carrying a duffel bag.
He gets in his car out front and drives off.
Jenny follows him to a trim little house four miles away.
William goes inside, carrying the duffel bag.
Jenny parks, and texts Sophia.
I followed William. He left this morning at 10:45.
He went into a house at 435 Harrison Street — do you know anyone at that address?
No. And he said he was going to the gym!
That must be where Pearl lives!
Okay, I’m going to investigate…
Jenny gets out of the car and takes a quick look inside the mailbox.
The mail in the mailbox is all addressed to Bonnie Gelbart.
Not Pearl?
Nope.
So he’s seeing Pearl AND Bonnie? OMG!
Now let’s not jump to any conclusions just yet.
Oh, I forgot to tell you something.
I found a piece of paper in the pocket of his jeans last night.
It had some weird code on it.
Code? What kind of code?
Here, let me dig it out of my purse.
It says: k2, k2tog, yo, k1, ssk.
What could it mean?
And how does it relate to Pearl and Bonnie?
And the fact that my boyfriend has been living a lie?!
Hold on. Let me go up to the house.
Jenny walks up to the front door as if she is about to ring the doorbell.
Then she looks inside the living room window.
What she sees astonishes her.
She returns to her car and texts Sophia.
I’m pretty sure I know what’s going on.
What is it?
Is there any way you can get off work for a few hours?
I think so.
Tell William to be home at 3.
I’ll meet you both there.
At 3 p.m., Jenny knocks on Sophia and William’s door.
Sophia answers the door and lets Jenny in.
William looks at Jenny quizzically.
This is Jenny. I hired her.
You hired her? To do what?
To find out what you’re hiding from me.
Oh no.
I was going to tell you…
I didn’t know how you’d react.
I know about Pearl. And now Bonnie.
How could you?!!
Who’s Pearl? And how do you know about Bonnie?
Wait a minute. If I could just step in here.
The fact is, William IS hiding something from you, Sophia.
It’s just not what you think.
When I looked inside Bonnie Gelbart’s house today, the puzzle pieces started to come together.
You followed me to Bonnie’s house?!
If you had just been honest with Sophia, that wouldn’t have been necessary.
But yes, I followed you.
She turns to Sophia.
And when I looked in the window, I saw William not with one woman.
But eight of them.
WHAT?!!
And they were all…
Jenny pauses dramatically.
Knitting.
William looks down at the floor, ashamed.
I checked with my aunt who knits.
That code you saw on that paper was a set of instructions for a knitting pattern.
And purl isn’t a name.
It’s a knitting term.
It’s when you put the needle through the front of the stitch from right to left.
Isn’t that right, William?
A slight smile comes across William’s face.
That’s right.
Sophia looks stunned.
You…knit?
William summons the courage to look directly at Sophia.
Yes. I…I’m a knitter.
I must admit it was quite a sight.
There they were — eight dainty women sitting in a circle.
And one six-foot-tall man, muscles and all.
All with their knitting needles and balls of yarn.
See? Even you’re making fun of me.
My grandma taught me to knit when I was eight.
And I loved it so much.
But I stopped because kids starting bullying me over it.
It’s why I started lifting weights, so I could protect myself.
Oh, that’s terrible!
But a year ago I saw some yarn in a knitting shop window.
And it was like it was calling to me.
So I started up again.
But why didn’t you tell me?
I was afraid you might leave me if you knew.
You call me your manly man all the time and like to feel my muscles.
I was afraid I’d seem like less of a man to you if you knew I liked to knit.
Baby, that’s not true at all!
I LOVE that you have this side to you.
And I’m so happy that you’re not cheating on me.
The two of them embrace while Jenny looks on, smiling.
After a while, William speaks.
Now that I know you feel this way, there’s something I want to show you.
He goes into the bathroom and emerges with the duffel bag he was carrying earlier.
I’ve been hiding this in a cubbyhole in the bathroom closet.
I finished it today.
He pulls out a beautiful red and black sweater with an intricate design.
It’s for you.
He holds it open and she puts it on.
It fits perfectly.
Oh, it’s beautiful!
I was going to say I got it at a store.
It looks like it could have come from a store, right?
Only from the finest designer store.
But to me it looks a million times better than that.
Because it was made by you.
With love.
Soon it appears that the sweater and all other clothing will be removed…
So Jenny quietly leaves the house.
She is happy that her first case as a detective for Are They Cheating? Investigations has led to a resounding answer of NO.
